resources.string: A staple Kenyan dish made with maize flour and served with braised collard greens.

Nyama Choma, which translates to "roasted meat" in Swahili, is a beloved dish in Kenya and across East Africa. It is a simple yet flavorful dish that highlights the natural taste of the meat, which is typically marinated with a mixture of spices and grilled over an open flame until tender and charred.

Chapati is a staple food in Kenyan cuisine, often served alongside main dishes such as stews, curries, or grilled meats. It is a type of unleavened flatbread made from a simple dough of flour, water, salt, and sometimes oil or fat. Chapati is known for its soft and flaky texture, making it a delicious accompaniment to a wide variety of dishes.
Githeri, a traditional Kenyan dish made from a hearty mixture of maize (corn) and beans, typically cooked together until tender and seasoned with various spices.

Mandazi is a beloved snack in Kenya and other East African countries, often enjoyed with tea or coffee for breakfast or as a sweet treat throughout the day. These deep-fried doughnuts are soft on the inside and slightly crispy on the outside, with a hint of sweetness and aromatic spices.

Samosas are savory, triangular-shaped pastries filled with a mixture of spiced potatoes, peas, and sometimes meat, then deep-fried until golden brown and crispy. They are a beloved snack in Kenya and are often enjoyed as appetizers or street food.
Pilau is a classic dish in Kenyan cuisine, known for its rich spices, tender meat, and aromatic rice. It is often served during festive occasions, celebrations, and family gatherings.

Matoke is a traditional dish that originated from Uganda but is also widely enjoyed in Kenya and other East African countries. It is made from green bananas, also known as cooking bananas or plantains, which are peeled, chopped, and cooked until tender. Matoke can be prepared in various ways, but one common method involves stewing the bananas with onions, tomatoes, and spices to create a flavorful and hearty dish.

Mursik is a unique and culturally significant beverage in Kenya, known for its distinctive fermented flavor. It is traditionally made by fermenting cows milk in a specially prepared gourd known as a "sotet" or "sotit." The gourd is charred on the inside to impart a smoky flavor to the milk, and ash from certain plants is added to aid in the fermentation process. Mursik is typically consumed as a refreshing drink, and it is also believed to have various health benefits..

Kenyan Masala Chips are a delicious and indulgent snack or side dish commonly found in street food stalls and local eateries throughout Kenya. These crispy French fries are elevated with the addition of a special masala spice blend, which gives them a unique and aromatic flavor

Mahamri is a traditional Kenyan pastry that is similar to doughnuts but with a slightly different texture and flavor profile. It is often enjoyed as a breakfast dish or as a sweet treat with tea or coffee.
Slow-cooked beef stew with potatoes, carrots, and other vegetables, seasoned with Kenyan spices.

Kachumbari is a popular Kenyan salad known for its simplicity and refreshing flavors. It is often served as a side dish or accompaniment to grilled meats, stews, or rice dishes. This salad is particularly popular during gatherings, celebrations, and outdoor barbecues.

Fish in Coconut Sauce is a beloved dish along the Kenyan coast, where seafood is abundant and coconut is a common ingredient in many dishes. This dish typically features fresh fish cooked in a creamy coconut curry sauce infused with aromatic spices.

Ugali is a fundamental part of the Kenyan diet and is made from maize flour (also known as cornmeal) cooked with water to a thick, dough-like consistency. It serves as a staple carbohydrate and is commonly eaten alongside various meat, vegetable, or fish dishes. Omena, also known as "dagaa" in some regions, are tiny dried fish that are a popular ingredient in Kenyan cooking, especially in the Lake Victoria region. They are rich in protein, omega-3 fatty acids, and other nutrients, making them a nutritious addition to meals.
Strong black tea with milk and sugar, often enjoyed with mandazi or chapati.

Mukimo is a beloved dish in Kenyan cuisine, particularly among the Kikuyu ethnic group, although it is enjoyed by people from various backgrounds across the country. It is a hearty and flavorful dish that combines mashed potatoes with other ingredients to create a delicious and satisfying meal.
A flavorful curry made with mixed vegetables and coconut milk.

Mbaazi is a popular dish in Kenya, especially along the coastal regions, where it is often enjoyed as a breakfast dish or as a side dish for lunch or dinner. It is made from pigeon peas, also known as Congo peas or gungo peas, which are simmered in creamy coconut milk along with aromatic spices.

Kenyan Chicken Curry is a popular dish enjoyed across the country, known for its bold flavors and comforting appeal. It combines tender chicken pieces with a fragrant curry sauce made from a blend of spices and other ingredients.
Chili Scrambled Eggs is a simple yet flavorful dish made by whisking together eggs with chopped chili peppers and seasoning, then cooking them until fluffy and fully set
Fragrant rice dish cooked with beef, spices, and caramelized onions.
Spicy potato fritters, often served as a snack or appetizer.
Mashed potatoes mixed with peas, corn, and sometimes spinach, a traditional Kikuyu dish.
Fragrant rice dish cooked with beef, vegetables, and aromatic spices.
Hearty soup made with lentils, tomatoes, and Kenyan spices.
Crispy fried fish seasoned with Kenyan spices, often served with ugali.
A common dish made from cooked beans saut√©ed with onions, tomatoes, and spices.
"Well-fried sosi soya chunks" refers to a dish made with soya chunks, also known as textured vegetable protein (TVP) or soy meat, seasoned and fried until crispy and well-cooked.
Green grams (mung beans) cooked with onions, tomatoes, and spices, a nutritious and popular dish in Kenya.
